intro: Eriostemon pachyphyllus, commonly known as the broad-leaf eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
